Description: Job Description:·      Jazan Integrated Gasification and Power Company (JIGPC) is a $12 billion joint venture between Air Products, ACWA Power and Saudi Aramco. JIGPC utilizes known and proven technologies to process vacuum residue from the Jazan Refinery into hydrogen, steam, and power.·      The position of Site EHS Manager – Projects Delivery is a position within the Jazan Integrated Gasification & Power Company. This position will report to the Project Director (Delivery) and functionally to EHSS Director. He will manage the projects construction and commissioning EH&S program in the operating plant environment.·      The role of Site EHS Manager will ensure that all construction EH&S targets are met or exceeded during the Construction phases of the projects.·      While the position will be administrated through the Project Delivery Department, the Site EH&S Manager Projects will take technical EH&S related directives from the EHS&S Department.·      This is a site-based role, with 8x2 week rotation.Skills
Skills: Experience & Skills:
·      15+ years of EH&S experience in petrochemical/oil & gas industry with at least 5 years in a managerial role
·      Brownfield experience is a must
·      Experience with Saudi Aramco EH&S management system is essential
·      Construction and commissioning experience in the brownfield environment is essential
·      10+ years of experience in EPC environment
·      Demonstratable subcontractor management skills
·      Strong experience in Permit to Work, Confined Space Entry, LOTO, Work at Height, Lifting & Rigging, Excavation, etc. processes
·      Strong experience in SIMOPS operations including the planning, communications, coordination and control
·      Strong technical competence in Construction & Commissioning Safety, supported by a thorough knowledge of international standards for management of EH&S and Risk
·      High level of knowledge and experience in incident and crisis management in remote locations
·      Able to demonstrate the knowledge of the impact of decisions/changes on project EH&S risks and overall project success
·      Investigating incidents in leading or facilitating role. Overseeing the assessment and expedient reporting of incidents to determine immediate actions and implementation of learnings
·      Able to develop an EH&S culture that empowers the workforce to deliver EH&S performance
·      Demonstrate leadership, integrity, and interpersonal skills
·      Possess a strong passion and commitment to employee involvement, team building, diversity, and inclusion
·      Strong planning, coordination, and risk management skills
·      Energy, drive and determination to build up high performance safety management and to assist leading the Site Team to deliver the required results
·      Supporting and collaborating with the onsite contractors, subcontractors, inspectors, and others in a respectful and professional manner to focus on driving the Project Safety Culture
·      A good understanding and experience with worker’s health & welfare programs and ability to ensure its implementation by subcontractors.
Qualifications:
·      Bachelor’s degree in EH&S Management, Environmental or Chemical Engineering, or related discipline.
·      Incident investigation qualification (Tap Root, Sologic RCA, or similar)
·      Knowledge & experience of ISO 14001 & ISO 45001
·      Emergency response management qualification is plus
